data.title: Laurence Olivier (Actor)
data.meta_description: Profile of actor Laurence Olivier with biographical facts, historical events and Laurence Olivier's married life.
data.text:
Laurence Olivier

Profession: Actor

Biography: Noël Coward's Private Lives, Wuthering Heights and Marathon Man.

Born: May 22, 1907

Birthplace: Dorking, England, United Kingdom

Generation: Greatest Generation

Chinese Zodiac: Goat/Sheep

Star Sign: Gemini

Died: July 11, 1989 (aged 82)

Cause of Death: Cancer

Articles and Photos

Wuthering Heights Author Dies at 30

Emily Brontë, author of the classic novel Wuthering Heights, died on this day. Like her sisters Anne and Charlotte, she passed away at a tragically young age.

Historical Events

"Wuthering Heights" film based on the Emily Brontë novel, directed by William Wyler and starring Merle Oberon and Laurence Olivier, premieres in Los Angeles

"Rebecca" based on the book by Daphne du Maurier, directed by Alfred Hitchcock, and starring Laurence Olivier and Joan Fontaine premieres in Miami, Florida (Oscar - Best Picture 1941)

Laurence Olivier is featured on the cover of LIFE magazine

"Hamlet" directed by and starring Laurence Olivier's opens at Park Avenue Cinema (Best Picture 1949)

6th Golden Globes: Johnny Belinda, Laurence Olivier, & Jane Wyman win

21st Academy Awards: "Hamlet", Laurence Olivier & Jane Wyman win, Walter & John Huston become 1st father-and-son team to win awards

Terence Rattigan's play "The Sleeping Prince" premieres in London starring Vivien Leigh and Laurence Olivier

"Spartacus", directed by Stanley Kubrick and starring Kirk Douglas and Laurence Olivier, premieres in NYC

Film adaptation of Ira Levin's novel "The Boys from Brazil", starring Gregory Peck and Laurence Olivier premieres

Personal Life

"Wuthering Heights" actor Laurence Olivier (33) weds "Gone With The Wind" actress Vivien Leigh (26)

Famous Actors

Billy Dee Williams

Burt Lancaster

Harry Morgan

John Barrymore

Kevin Smith

Rip Taylor
